days.explanation: Eye, nose, and mouth are parts of the face; hand is not.
Mercury, Venus, and Earth are classified planets; Pluto is a dwarf planet.
Level, radar, and palindrome are palindromes; paper is not.
Triangle, square, and circle are 2D shapes; cube is 3D.
Violin, guitar, and piano are string instruments; drums are percussion.
Shakespeare, Dickens, and Tolstoy are authors; Einstein was a physicist.
January, April, and July are months; Tuesday is a day of the week.
Sodium, oxygen, and carbon are in the first two rows of the periodic table; iron is much heavier.
Rome, Athens, and Cairo are cities; Amazon is a river.
Red, green, and blue are primary light colors; cyan is secondary.
Chess, sudoku, and scrabble are skill-based games; poker relies heavily on chance.
Venus, Mars, and Jupiter are planets; Polaris is a star.
Dog, cat, and cow are mammals; eagle is a bird.
Square, pentagon, and hexagon are polygons; sphere is not.
Python, Java, and C++ are programming languages; Excel is software.
Water, gold, and diamond are tangible substances; air is a mixture of gases.
Amazon, Nile, and Yangtze are rivers; Everest is a mountain.
Tesla, Edison, and Newton were scientists; Picasso was a painter.
North, east, and south are compass directions; up is not.
Copper, silver, and gold are metals; sand is not.
Einstein, Curie, and Darwin were scientists; Mozart was a composer.
